revision.comment: standard quote handling in WP;standard Apostrophe/quotation marks in WP;add/change/refine category; MOS fixes using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian |name = Myq Kaplan |image = Myq Kaplan, the Meltdown, December 2011.jpg |imagesize = |caption = Kaplan in December 2011 |pseudonym = |birth_name = Michael Kaplan |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|10|7}} |birth_place = [[Livingston, New Jersey]] |medium = [[Stand-up comedian]] |active = 2005–present |genre = |subject = |influences = |spouse = |notable_work = |signature = |website = {{URL|http://myqkaplan.com/}} }}
'''Myq Kaplan''' (born October 7, 1978<ref name=MySpace>[http://www.myspace.com/myqkaplan Myq Kaplan] at [[MySpace]]</ref>) is an American [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]]. Born '''Michael Kaplan'''<ref name=Hoot>Channon, Alison. [http://thehoot.net/articles/5876 "Brandeis comedians take smarts to the stage"], ''The Brandeis Hoot'', 13 March 2009.</ref> in [[Livingston, New Jersey]],<ref>Wilkowe, Ellen S. [http://www.dailyrecord.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=2011301290051 "Things to do in Morris County, NJ: Last Comic Standing tour comes to Morristown, NJ, Jan. 15"]{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, ''[[Daily Record (Morristown)]]'', January 13, 2011. Accessed February 24, 2011. "One-time aspiring singer/songwriter Myq Kaplan, 32, formerly of Livingston and now of New York City, changed his tune … and converted to comedy."</ref><ref name=badslava>Yaryshkin, Slava. [http://www.badslava.com/2009/04/myq-kaplan.html ''Stand-up Comedy 101'' Interview with Myq Kaplan], 6 April 2009.</ref> he is based in [[Boston]]<ref name="Alterman July 2009">Alterman, Sara Faith. [http://thephoenix.com/BLOGS/phlog/archive/2009/07/23/montreal-comedy-festival-the-new-faces-showcase.aspx "Montreal Comedy Festival: The New Faces showcase"], [[The Phoenix (newspaper)|''The Boston Phoenix'']], 23 July 2009.</ref> and [[New York City]].<ref>Gadino, Dylan P. [http://punchlinemagazine.com/blog/2009/07/just-for-laughs-new-faces-part-2 Just For Laughs: New Faces"], ''Punchline'', 27 July 2009.</ref>
==Education== Kaplan received his bachelor's degree from [[Brandeis University]] in 2000<ref name=Hoot /> and a master's degree in [[linguistics]] from [[Boston University]].<ref name="BU Today">Laskowski, Nicole. [http://www.bu.edu/today/video/2008/01/08/last-comic-standing "The Last Comic Standing?"], ''[[BU Today]]'', 8 August 2007.</ref> While a student at Boston University in 2005, he won its "funniest student" contest.<ref name="BU Today" />
==Comedy career== Kaplan tours North America regularly and has performed over 1,000 shows at [[comedy club]]s.<ref name="BU Today" />
He was a semifinalist in the 2006 Boston Comedy Festival and in the 2006 Seattle Comedy Competition.<ref name="BU Today" /> He was one of nine finalists in [[Comedy Central]]'s 2007 ''Open Mic Fight'' competition. In 2008, a reader poll by Boston's ''[[The Phoenix (newspaper)|The Phoenix]]'' named him Local Comedian of the Year.<ref>[http://thephoenix.com/theBest/Boston/2008/Arts/LocalComedian/ Readers' Pick: Best Local Comedian: Myq Kaplan], ''The Boston Phoenix'', 2008.</ref> He took part in [[Montreal]]'s [[Just for Laughs]] comedy festival in 2009.<ref name="Alterman July 2009" /><ref>Borden, Jane. [http://www3.timeoutny.com/newyork/tonyblog/2009/07/just-for-laughs-in-montreal-day-one/ "Just for Laughs in Montreal: Day One"], ''[[Time Out (company)|Time Out]] New York'', 23 July 2009.</ref>
===Television, internet and recordings=== Myq Kaplan has appeared on Comedy Central's ''[[Live at Gotham]]'' and in promotional work for the network. He has been featured on ''[[ABC News Now]]''.
On December 16, 2009, he performed for the first time on ''[[The Tonight Show]]''.<ref>[https://archive.is/20130204191008/http://www.tonightshowwithconanobrien.com/video/myq_kaplan_(12/16/09)/1186242/ ''Tonight Show'' video clip],{{dead link|date=June 2010}} 16 December 2009.</ref> Kaplan also appeared as a contestant on the competition TV series ''[[Last Comic Standing#Season 7: Summer 2010|Last Comic Standing]]'' during the summer 2010.<ref>{{cite news |title=New York Auditions Day 2 |work=A.V. Club |publisher=The Onion |date = June 21, 2010 | first=Steve | last=Heisler |url=http://www.avclub.com/articles/new-york-auditions-day-2,42325/ }}</ref> He placed fifth in the competition.<ref>[http://www.realitytvworld.com/news/last-comic-standing-crowns-felipe-esparza-seventh-season-champ-11425.php "'Last Comic Standing' crowns Felipe Esparza seventh-season champ"], Reality TV World.com, August 10, 2010.</ref>
He is also a frequent guest on long running comedy [[podcast]] ''[[Keith and the Girl]]''.
Myq Kaplan has been a guest on the podcast "You Made It Weird With Pete Holmes" 2 times, one released on April 4, 2012 and as a returning guest released December 20, 2017
Kaplan hosts his own podcast ''Hang Out with Me''.<ref>myqkaplan.com</ref>
On April 30, 2010, his [[Comedy Central Presents]] special aired on Comedy Central.
Myq Kaplan's comedy album ''Vegan Mind Meld'' was released April 27, 2010, and his second album, ''Please Be Seated'' was released in 2012.
In August 2014, Myq Kaplan's one-hour standup special entitled ''Small, Dork, and Handsome'' appeared on Netflix for streaming.
On February 14, 2014 Kaplan was the first guest on [[Ken Reid (comedian)|Ken Reid]]'s ''TV Guidance Counselor Podcast''.
On January 31, he was the first guest on ''Bombing with Mike Dorval'', where he talked about his joke writing and a joke that bombed for the New York Times.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://roxlabs.net/2016/02/01/01-myq-kaplan/|title=01 – Myq Kaplan {{!}} Rox Labs|access-date=2016-06-11}}</ref>
Kaplan was also a contestant on the tenth season of ''[[America's Got Talent (season 10)|America's Got Talent]].'' He was eliminated in the Quarterfinals.
==Personal life== Kaplan is also a musician, primarily as a guitarist and vocalist. He is a [[Veganism|vegan]],<ref>{{cite web |title=Art of the Animal: Myq Kaplan |format=video |date=August 24, 2011 |first=Jasmin |last=Singer |work=Art of the Animal, Video |publisher=Our Hen House |url= http://www.ourhenhouse.org/2011/08/art-of-the-animal-myq-kaplan/ }}</ref> polyamorous <ref>{{cite web|title=Shame On: Polyamory|url=http://shameon.libsyn.com/009-polyamory-myq-kaplan}}</ref> and once described himself as "atheistic".<ref>[https://archive.is/20120710151929/http://myqkaplan.com/bio About Myq Kaplan (archived)] at his [http://myqkaplan.com/?page_id=2 official website] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101125080631/http://myqkaplan.com/?page_id=2 |date=2010-11-25 }}</ref>
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==External links== *[http://www.myqkaplan.com/ Official website] *[http://godzillionaire.blogspot.com/ Myq Kaplan's blog] *{{IMDb name|3050184}} *[http://www.myspace.com/myqkaplan Myq Kaplan] at [[MySpace]] *[http://www.facebook.com/pages/Myq-Kaplan/13718328274/ Myq Kaplan] at [[Facebook]] *[https://twitter.com/myqkaplan Myq Kaplan] at [[Twitter]] *[http://www.gentlemensclubpodcast.com/post/5761883287 Myq Kaplan] podcast interview on ''The Gentlemen's Club with Caleb Bacon'' *[http://www.thespittake.com/2012/09/25/myq-kaplan-and-micah-sherman-please-be-seated-bseen-media/ Myq Kaplan] album review
{{Authority control}}
